content: No, the Luftwaffe did not achieve their primary mission during the Battle of Britain. Despite heavily bombing the RAF airfields and infrastructure, the RAF was able to maintain their defenses and continue to fight back. The RAF also had an advantage in technology, as they had developed the radar system which helped them to detect incoming German aircraft and launch their own attacks. In the end, the Luftwaffe failed to gain air superiority over the RAF, which prevented the planned invasion of Britain by sea.
